Not a shooter game, contrary to what you might expect at a glance. Similar to the old Xbox 360 title Wartech: Senko no Ronde, it's a 1v1 fighting game with cute bullet-hell girls. There aren't that many characters and the gameplay is relatively simplistic, but even then, it's really fun, and the characters are pretty different. Super fun in multiplayer.
If you're a fan of both shoot 'em ups and fighting games, this game gives an interesting mix of the two with a quirky feel that reminds me of Touhou. Also, the music is great.
Fast and Action packed!!! I HIGHLY recommend buying this game! Worth every penny, I hope to face one of you! lol
Game's online multiplayer is absolutely broken.   From what little gameplay I experienced, it was fun; but don't expect to be playing this game online with friends.

It's... alright, I suppose. It's a versus shoot-em-up, which is nice, because we need more versus shoot-em-ups. It's a low-polish, barely-story, basic-art game... but it's still fun as a casual pick-up-and-play kind of game. So it narrowly gets a Recommendation.

If you don't buy this game, you are personally insulting me.   Serious review:  I've been playing this game on both PC and Ps3 since 2011. Game is amazing. Fast, Frantic, Hectic. I describe it to friends as a 'High-Movement, Versus Shoot 'Em Up'. and it's pretty accurate. You control a character and fire weapons and laser swords and giant fists at your opponent to reduce their hp to zero at an alarming rate. The game is simple on the surface and allows very deep and quick-reaction strategy. When you become more skilled you both see and feel its rewards.  There are tiers of 'this character is definitely better than this character', but there are no flowcharts. It's a matchup-intensive game but it is driven by KNOWLEDGE, and by ADAPTATION. Any character can win. You have be very cognizant of situations and understand when to push, when to back off, when to set up. There's a lot that goes on constantly. You have to watch the camera, you have to watch what's /not/ on the camera, everything is nuts because it all happens so fast.  The first fifty or so rounds that you seriously play in this game will be a blur of 'I have no idea what's going on and I have no idea what i'm doing.' This is -normal- and you'll acclimate quickly from there. It's just like watching or playing anything for the first time.   There are cons, but to me they don't mean anything compared to the pros. - Some people don't like the camera functionality. (I think it adds a layer of strategy and meta - Despite what I said above, some characters really do struggle in every match. - Please never pick QP unless you're being a nutbar. She's too good and is banned in competitive circles.  I love Acceleration of Suguri X Edition. I want you to love it, too. Add me and let's play.

Hats off to the team that brought this to Steam. All of the problems I encountered at launch have since been fixed and this is a fantastic title I'm glad to have in my library. Fast paced 2D aerial combat at its finest. Pick this up.
